case_vignette: A 62-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife for increased forgetfulness and unsteady gait over the past 3 months. He is a journalist and has had difficulty concentrating on his writing. He also complains of urinary urgency recently. His temperature is 36.8°C (98.2°F) and blood pressure is 139/83 mm Hg. He is oriented only to person and place. He is able to recall 2 out of 3 words immediately and 1 out of 3 after five minutes. He has a slow, broad-based gait and takes short steps. Neurological examination is otherwise normal. Urinalysis is normal.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.

The case vignette does not mention any family history of neurological conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Mild Cognitive Impairment
